values:
Well, last night was interesting.  I'll have to post on it later as I'm at C-L with a butt-load to do.  But to give you a brief idea of the goings on I went with Tyler to see Into the Wild (which is probably one of the most incredible and inspiring movies I've seen in a while) then figured out I'm an element with lots of electrons orbiting me (where I'm magnesium and friendboys are electrons...I'll explain this later too).

Then there was much shoppage at the Wal-Mart where Ir and I saw this older lady and her man-friend spend about twenty minutes deliberating over condoms.  Seriously.  They had to be in their seventies.  It was very comical.  What was even better was when they asked this twenty-something dude (who was trying really hard to look cool while his girlfriend compared tampons) which ones he preferred.  I had to leave at this point.  It was just too priceless.  Plus they might have asked me next.

Okay, it's time to bust it at C-L.  I'll post some more junk later.

Oh and I changed the background on the myspace so now it won't lock peeps' computers up.  

*hearts*
L~bug

I nearly got into a fight on Friday at work.  It was bad.  And I finally put my foot down and told my admin that if the crap didn't stop I was going to tender my resignation sooner than I planned to.  

Thankfully the workday went by quickly and I was able to blow off steam at Mom and Dad's.  We watched What Women Want and I got to talk to Wayne for a little bit.  Then, as I was getting ready to leave, Ir called and told me to get my booty home because we were going out.  So I drove to the apartment and we met up with our new neighbor Shane and headed down to JC.  We sat around Starbucks til they closed and for about an hour following then headed over to two gas stations and the Acoustic Coffee House.  It was pretty cool, other than feeling kinda like a third wheel.  

Not like that's not a common occurance.

But anyway.

I'm putting my application for school in the mail on Monday.  I've got my resignation letter ready.  After the drama of Friday (which was over some misplaced faxes and unnamed but pointed accusations) I've decided to just keep it on hand at all times because if things get bad, I'm done.  Competely and totally done.

I'll rant more on that later.  Privately of course.

Hm...  I think I'm on one of my tears again.  I'm kind of in one of my gypsy moods.  I can't stand staying still and in one place.  I want to travel.  Everywhere.  So far I've put around 500 miles on my car this week.  So far it's not abated at all.  

Ug.

Anyway, I'm off to watch V for Vendetta.

*hearts*

I've been doing research lately and I've finally come to a decision. 



I'm going back to school. 

I only need three semesters and I will have a new degree. 

Yes, I know how much work that entails. 

Yes, I have the full support and blessing of my parents. 

Yes, I do realize I will be a zombie at the end of it all. 


Then my plans are to either transfer to ETSU or to the med school pre-program at the UT Memphis campus.  If all goes well, I should have a new degree in as little as six semesters.  

Boo-ya! 


Okay, I'm entertaining the Charlie and his supa-cute puddy Downy tonight so I'm off to be a proper hostess. 

*hearts* & cheers! 

L~bug

Omg, I'm so exhausted it's unbelievable.

Hello Fall, it's been awhile.  The temperature dropped today.  I say dropped but you should read 'plunged".  Yeah.  That's right, plunged.  Yesterday I strolled around in nice balmy 78 degree weather, this morning I woke up and it was hovering around 49 degrees.  Seriously.  

Needless to say, it's a little chilly.


As we speak, I'm wrapped up in my happy flying pig Quillow (folded up it's a pillow, unfolded it's a quilt, get it?) with a nice hot cup of Irish coffee, blogging, and watching 1408.  

So far so good.

Work was fairly decent today.  At least I didn't get yelled at.  And I wasn't fired.  I guess you could say things are looking up.

I'm thinking about going back to school.  I've almost got my plans finalized.  I just need to check with my parents and we'll have a nice family discussion about it and maybe I'll post on it later.

Ok, it's time to get back to 1408.


Oooo, spooky!

I have this fish.  He's a sucky fish.  His name is Sucky.  

Sucky lives in my roomie's tank with her fish Buddy.  

For the most part Buddy and Sucky get along really well, aside from chasing each other around when food is dropped in.

Recently Buddy has not been feeling too well.

Sucky does not like Buddy to feel bad.

When I got home today, I found Sucky going ape-crap swimming around and around, latching on to things then doing some more ape-crap laps.  

Then I noticed Buddy.

Rather, parts of Buddy.

Sucky ate Buddy.  

Literally sucked his scales and fins and stuff off.

I'm serious people.

Sucked. His. Scales. Off. 

Fins too.

This is bad, very, very bad.

I'm afraid of my fish.

But don't tell him.

Ok?



(scared) *hearts*

L~bug

I've been thinking a lot about college recently.  Mainly because my roommate has finally gone back to school and it's making me wish I could be right there with her, especially when all the school supplies were in.  (Man, I miss buying those.)

And that got me thinking about my days at ETSU and Airport U before that and all the time and energy I poured into them.  I miss so much about those years of higher education.  I feel so apart from this 'real world' place I'm at right now (not that I don't love my job--okay well, I've been loving a little less these past few weeks), like I'm supposed to be some place else, striding across neatly cut quads with the chill of autumn in the air not breathing in the stale smells of paper, dust and toner.

I want to be back in my dorm.
I want to study til all hours of the morning and pull 1800-word essays out of my butt an hour before they're due.
I want to go back to the days of Perkins runs and group meetings at Starbucks and ensemble trips to Wal-Mart and Barnes & Noble.
I miss having group discussions on psychology classes and projects that required several days' worth of meeting in dorm rooms.
I miss the pancake breaks during dead week.
I miss spending nine and ten hours in the library engrossed in books on folklore and medicinal anthropology.  

Heck, I even miss my Shakespeare professor and his mysogynistic diatribes!

I guess mostly I miss having a close-knit group of friends within walking distance who were at almost any given time happy to tag along on some absurd run across town for whatever floated our boats.  Except for those few days when I first transferred to ETSU, I was never lonely in college.  

Oh, and lets not forget that I was a size 12 at ETSU.  Yeah, I miss that too.

I just want to go back.

*hearts*
L~bug

There are a lot of things I need to blog on but I can't.  This list would include but is not limited to:
~ My suck-tastic job
~ my current search for a new job.
~ a welcome surprise
~ Mel & Greg's wedding
~ my surprise friend-boys
~ my annoyance at my defragmentor taking 4 hours (4 HOURS!!!!) to complete.
~ drama, drama, drama
~ my state of inept-hood

Unfortunately I just don't have the time right now and I'm exhausted from work.  It's just not been a good few weeks.

*hearts*

L~bug

"Now wait right there!  Something goes in front of you.  We've got to get a...we've got to get a....get a doo-hickey to put right there."


Go me and my college education!

I swear I have not been drinking AT ALL today.  

Well, except for my cherry limeade from Sonic but there was no alochol involved, cause Julie wouldn't approve.

*hearts*

L~bug

The past two weeks have sucked wang like nothing ever sucked wang before.  Yes, even more than when Jessa and I were smote in the Swamp last year.  Ug.  I'm not planning on going into much detail about it but lets just say that I have become a great student of keeping my tongue curbed instead of flying some birds and merrily skipping my way to my car and a new job.

And that might still happen if I have any more weeks like this past one.


But anyway.  


So Sunday night I went to dinner with Tyler and we spent a long time talking about a lot of things.  Then we got into a great discussion of a modern day League of Extraordinary Gentlemen.  
Our final group ended up with:
- Kay Scarpetta
- Harry Potter
- Jack Ryan
- Hannibal Lector
- Claudia whomever from The Vampire Chronicles
- There was someone else but I don't remember who.

Oh, and Maya Angelo.

Yeah, figure that one out.

Ok, seeing as how I haven't eaten in four days or slept in three, I'm going to try go die on the couch now.

*hearts*

L~bug
Here's some classy dining for you:  apple wine and pizza rolls.

Loss is part of everybody's journey and indeed loss shows us what is precious.  Love is precious.  People are precious.  Letting go when the time has come is precious.  And so is taking a risk.

Life is often about picking up the pieces and moving on after bad things happen...If some lives form a perfect circle, others take shape in ways we cannot predict or always understand.  Loss has been a part of my journey but it has always shown me what is precious.  So has a love for which I can only be grateful.

I bought a car! 


It's an 04 VW Jetta, Platinium Gray with two-tone gray and black leather interior (that's a factory shot, not my actual car).  It's got the leather package and premium sound.  Plus it only had 18800 miles on it and was priced at 15900 but I got it for 15400 with tax, title, and all.  YAY!

I found it at Donohoo Auto in Pelham, AL (plugplugplug).  They're super-nice and helped me with everything.  I'm definately going to be a repeat customer when it's time to trade in my gray baby. That is, if I ever do.

Anywhoo, I've been in Franklin for the state cse conference which was a shorter version of the NCSEA one I went to last month.  I left for Pelham from Franklin and spent about 7 hours on the road total.  Kitty Junebug cost me $75 dollars in gas.  So far I've only had to fill up my Jetta twice--once right before leaving Alabama and once when I got to Maryville.

I drove most of the day yesterday and crashed at Jessa's.  I was going to just sleep in her driveway but she was muy kind and let me stay indoors.  We hung around with Crystal and Sarah and I got to see her cruise pics from this past March.

Next week I'm off for Hopkinsville, KY for a wedding so back to Nashville I go!

Ug, the apartment is nasty.  I'm sooo not going into that right now.  

Ok, I'm off to get ready for the bachelorette party.

*hearts*

So, it's the attack of the super creepy bugs at the Big Girl With My Own Semi-Corner Office Job.  Seriously, a few days ago there was this huge I-Wanna-Be-A-Big-Scary-Centipede-But-*TEARS*-I'm-Not Bug crawling all over my wall so I splatted it and a few days later (that would be today) I decided to remove his splatted former self from my wall (it was an unsightly mess) when I discovered instead of, well, scraping off he kind of disintegrated.  I had to leave my semi-corner office and squirm for a bit in HL's office.

In other news, I saw an old friend from high school right before Mom went into surgery.  He seemed well and I wish I could have spoken to him a bit more than I did. *pout*  Oh well, maybe we'll run into each other someday.  *crosses fingers*

Mel's wedding is in two weeks.  Yay!  Road trip!  Four blissful days of non-work (of course, when I get back to work, I'm going to be swamped even more than I already am).  

Okay, I'm off here to finish watching The Devil Wears Prada.

*hearts*
L~Bug
Mom's surgery went really, really well.  She was up and walking with next to no pain about 45 minutes after she left recovery.  Now to see if she can make it two months without bending.

That would be the question on my mind regarding my job at Crye-Leike.

Last night I was of the mind to keep it but after the know-it-all comments today and the half-assed instructions about new flyers and other handouts I'm supposed to do something with, I'm beginning to change my mind.

I'm going to sleep on it (which means by tomorrow I'll probably keep it) but it's so tempting to leave a note saying "F**k ya'll!  I'm outta here!"


Damn, it's soooo tempting.

L~bug the Seething

I spent a fabulous night with the Women's Fellowship on a retreat the past two days.  I had an incredible time and I'm sooooo glad I went.  

Beyond that, I'm exhausted and I have to work tomorrow so it's off to bed.  I'll update when I get a chance.

*hearts*

L~bug

Okay, so I got back from Florida (*sadness*) and I'm up to my armpits in dirty laundry.

Very brief recap:

Met a guy
Met a lot of attorneys
Spent an indecent amount of money on breakfast each morning
Had a spankin' good time at the Gala dinner
Will be spending months trying to catch up


Oh, and Mom's having surgery on the 22nd of this month so send some up for her, please.

I'll post more tomorrow.

*hearts*

L~bug

I leave for happy Florida on Saturday.  Yay!  I'll be there through Thursday, then back to work on Friday (ug) and I don't remember if I work C-L this weekend or not.  I'll have to remember to call MA and find out.

Our apartment is a bloody wreck.  Frank the Landed is putting down tile in our kitchen so the fridge is in the middle of the room and leveling agent is all over the floor as are these little spacers which HURT when you step on them with your bare feet.  Ouchie!  Hopefully, if every thing goes as planned, we'll have a brand-spanky new floor that's all pretty and not nasty like our other one.  After that Frank the Landed will start on our bathroom.  Yay!

I went shopping this evening and spent WAAAAAYYYY too much but I really needed the extra outfits to take with me.  Tomorrow I have to do laundry and start packing as soon as I get home which will be late as I've got three more piles at work to bust my arse on before I can leave on Friday.  And by piles I'm serious.  They're like small child size.  Very scary.

Anyway, I'm trying to blog and watch Letters from Iwa Jima and it's really not working out too well.  So I shall blog later.  

*hearts*

L~bug

<font size="7"><font color="#ff0000">HAP</font><font color="#ff6600">PY B</font><font color="#ffff00">IRT</font><font color="#00ff00">HDA</font><font color="#0000ff">Y KA</font><font color="#000080">TER</font><font color="#800080">S!!</font></font>

My car is now officially dubbed the Milkmobile.

Lets just say that my roommate is not safe in cars with cups of milk.

And that's all that I've got to say about that.


*hearts*

L~bug
All I have to say is J.K. Rowling knows her closures.

So.

I work with this super-cool chica (HL) and she was engaged to this pretty-cool dude (EB).  EB is a local artist who specializes in ginormous metal sculptures (Harvey my scroll bird is one of his pieces.  Harvey is not ginormous, just supa-cute!).  Anyhoo, the other day EB went off his rocker the other day over a photo HL had on her MySpace (the cyber-land of Satan, it would appear) and accused her of being a "paranoid, psychotic, jealous b**ch" (incidently, she is not, at all, any of these things).   Now, keeping in mind, these two have been together for almost 12 years (12!  12!  Like two years on to a decade.  Like eight years shy of twenty! 12!)  so it's not as though something like this (you know, her being a "paranoid, psychotic, jealous b**ch") just popped up out of now where (like daisies!).  Anyway, she left work early to meet him at Verizon to see about transferring his cellphone (which she pays for and just renewed for him so he could have a brand new phone (his b-day surprise)) to a private account.  At Verizon he threw such an incredible fit the store workers told him if he didn't calm down they'd have to call the police.  Needless to say, the engagement ring once gracing her left hand is now kaput.

And there's no need to really go into the other asshatty guys from this year.

And beyond that, there's not much else that's gone on.

*hearts*

L~Bug

I seriously heard this today:  "I went to Spain once.  You know, it's an entirely different country over there."  

No way!  Really?

So, a few days ago I had to do an intake re-app.  The interviewee's case had been closed for non-cooperation and she was all sorts of bent out of shape (apparently it's my fault that she didn't cooperate).  So the interview proceeded with introducing myself before being interrupted by a deluge of accusations and excuses and 'well, see, it's like this...' (i hate those).  During the fifteen minute pity party I learned that she and her children are barely making it, they are barely able to buy bread and peanut butter (which she says they've been living on for weeks now), and her car blew up so they couldn't make it up here to turn their forms in and they didn't have money for stamps and even if they could afford a stamp she didn't have an envelope to stick the forms in and yadda yadda and yadda yadda and so forth.

When I asked her how she made it up here (remembering that her car blew up and she and her kids were stranded all alone and then there were wolves) she said she had found a really good car at a really good deal and she'd had to spend a lot of money to get it fixed up.  So we get this whole non-coop thing sorted out and she's finally leaving.

And I go back to my Big Girl Grown Up Semi-Corner Office/Hovel when I hear what sounds like the world's loudest engine being revved up.  So I peek out of my boarded up window and low, there's my interviewee climbing into a modified Honda complete with non-factory spec ground effects kit, ginormous spoiler, and custom paint job.

Moral of this story:  Me and my kids might be starving but by golly we got ourselves a sweet ride.

Mom's b-day was yesterday.  She's been feeling a bit better now that she's gotten meds that actually dull the pain.  She's still got the tremoring in her hands when she tries to hold them still.  But at least she's not sweating out any more.  Progress.


I'll be going to Florida in August.  NCSEA is holding their annual convention in Orlando for a week in August.  The next week I'll be studying the pilot program that the Orange County's been doing for the past year and a half.  Then, in December, I'm off for Texas (the land of the big because there's not that much to do there except make things big) to a two day conference on support enforcement for immigrant applicants and foreign reciprocity.  

Needless to say, the cruise for next spring is offically now a no-go because I'll be spending an incredible amount on travel and lodging, never mind what I get into whilst in Florida for two weeks (Hello, Disney!).

I finally bought Finding Neverland.  Which saves me a lot of money since I tend to rent it so much.  I'm addicted to movies.

Today is Tracy's wedding.  I'm sooooo happy for her!  And I've got a pretty, pretty dress to wear (I hope I can find some shoes before 12).

Well, it's almost 9:30 and I've got to shop for some shoes.  :D

*hearts*

L~bug

I've had a trying two weeks.  Mom's hurt again.  She can barely walk, they have yet to find something to dull the pain.  I'm really worried about her. Really, really worried.

Work is going better.  

My personal life is strapped tight in a handbasket headed straight to you know where.  Thankfully things have calmed down in the past few days.  Last week I was about to rip my hair out and I've been tempted since to call someone up and give them a piece of my mind.

Tracy's wedding is this weekend and I'm really excited to see her.  We met during Honors Women's Studies class at Airport U and later on were Student Ambassadors.  She's one of the sweetest women I know and I'm so glad she found the love of her life.  :)

I'm hoping I can find something appropriate to wear since this shindig is just shy of black tie.  Oh darn, it would seem I have to go shopping.  Dang it.

;)

Time to do some online browsing.  :D


*hearts*

L~bug

I logged something like 58 hours in 4 days.  I feel like poo on toast.  Thankfully I'm off tomorrow or I'd probably not make it through the day.  I really need a break from work.  I even dreamt about it last night for Heaven's sake!  It was a nightmare: i was sitting in my parents' driveway and my car was parked on the carport for some reason and all of a sudden one of my ncps shows up from out of no where goes over to my car, opens the door, takes something out of my car and runs off into this giant bush that magically sprung up right beside the house.  And I just sat there and said to someone sitting beside me, "Hey, he took something from my car!" and they agreed and so I got up and walked around the bush and found the dude and grabbed him by the ear and lead him into the house where I was surrounded by a bunch of angry cps who kept shouting about how I was the devil and I worked for a communist state and so on and so forth.  Then some dog came in and everyone ran away.  And then I woke up because of a stupid spider jumped on my neck.  


I freakin' hate spiders.


Exhausted *hearts*

L~bug

Well things certainly took a turn for the WTF?!?   Seriously peeps, wrap it up.  It's not just for Christmas presents.  (Theme of office X-mas party this year.)

Digression.

I actually left work at a descent hour today.  Mildly surprising considering I usually log about 10 hours in the Hovel.  I call it that lovingly.  The Hovel.  It's my very own semi-corner office (the last one in the hallway before the fileroom) and despite being cramped and full of papers and files I'm sure I'll never really get through, it's my own personal, tiny corner of Big Girl In The Real World Space.

I have yet to decorate it, except for the occassional McDonald's or BK toy that I acquire.  Oh and Crappy the Reindeer.  I can't forget Crappy.  I'm tempted to put my diploma up but I'm afraid that might be a bit pretentious and maybe not a little bit stupid considering the others who have degrees have them in career-related fields like social work whilst mine is in English.  On the other hand, I busted my butt for that $18,000 piece of paper and it should do something a little more than just collect dust (not that it doens't collect dust well, mind you, but really, it should quit being such a couch potato).

I have this urge to punch the wall, not because I'm angry (well I am sort of) but because I have this really perverse desire to know what it feels like to have every bone in my hand broken.

I am such a downer right now.  Geeze.

Digression.

I have the cutest fish.  Okay, well, Ir and I have the cutest fish.  We have this nifty little tank with Ir's betta, Buddy, and my pleco, Sucky.  They're hilarious.  When we feed Buddy his pellets, Sucky will get jealous and when Buddy goes to eat a pellet or two or twenty Sucky will dart after him when he's at the surface and they'll get into this game of tag.  First Sucky chases Buddy, then Buddy chases Sucky and so on and so forth.  I spend a lot of time watching them do this.

I just looked at the clock.  I'm never going to get up in time tomorrow.  Crap.

Oh well, it's just the difference between going to work with unwashed hair versus being coherent at the buttcrack of dawn to get myself up to wash my hair.

And with that I think I'm off for bed.  I'll post on something later on.

*hearts*

L~bug

I miss writing letters.  The ones where you put pen to paper and have to get postage (or at least you have to be sneaky so Mrs. Austin doesn't stick you in detention for passing during her oh-so-boring Algebra II class).  

Or maybe it's just because I now have a lot of cool pens and want to show off their really pretty ink.  

Digression.


So, internet, long time no blog.  (Okay so I blogged on Saturday or Sunday of the impaling wonderment that was Apocalypto.  That doesn't really count, that was random blatherings, not a true post.)  

There have been a few developments over the past couple of days.  Most of them were bad and really not worth getting myself worked up over because of the lessness of them and the whole crap that was.  (That totally didn't make any sense and I apologize for that but it is what it is.)

In one of my many numerous searches for new blogdom I found a few really great reads.  I'll post links to them in the coming weeks.  I'm in the process of getting my aquariums set up.  I've got to clean one and I"ll probably end up selling the other or at least keeping the hardware and canning the aquarium itself.

Also on the agenda is switching cell phone plans.  For those of you who don't know, back in the day (like when I was with him and talking mainly to him on the phone) I switched to Nextel.  It seemed like a good idea at the time:  I was nearly going over my minutes talking to the ex, there was a really good plan offered, yadda, yadda.  So I switched from Alltel.  And I really dug Nextel.  Then we broke up and the reason for the switch became null and void.  So now I was left with bieng the odd Worm out in terms of my cell phone.  At first the bills weren't bad, then all of a sudden I went from an $85 bill to a $150 bill.  I about died when I got that.  So I researched the problems. 1) Nextel doesn't have texting plan, 2) I was being constantly double billed for taxes and Sprint Access charges.  I've spoken with Nextel Customer Service (apparently they've hired convicts from Mongolia to do their dirty work) and I've ranted to my local Nextel In-Store Monkey and I've just about had it with the Nextel.  But I am going to give them one last chance to get their junk together and not double charge me.  If they clean their act up I'll stick with it for the rest of my contract, if not hello My Circle (or Verizon depending on who can give me the better gov't discount--gotta love that 20%.  Booyah!)

I've been thinking about getting my hair cut.  Like, short.  Like shorter than the last time I had it cut.  Maybe (maybe of course meaning most likely not cause I'll punk out when it counts.).

Well, as I've got to be at work before 7 tomorrow, I think I'l say na-night.  Take care!

*hearts*

L~bug

P.S. Oh yeah, and I totally used the line "...and you know how I like me some words".  Yes I am that big of a dufus made even more so because it's completely true--I do like me some words.

And then some half-naked dude threw it's balls into another half-naked dude's face.

Man, Apocalypto rocks!



Um, I digress.

So.

In my tiny little neighborhood there are 5 different  complexes with 2 to 3 apartments in each building.  As I'm sure I mentioned before, the one I currently inhabit (La Casa!) is the oldest or at least the one most in need of a remodelling project.  On the other hand, the building below us, well only one of the apartments really, used to be a meth lab so I guess I can see getting it completed before moving on to the others.  

Well, calling it a lab would be a stretch.  It was more like a storage place for someone about to start a lab.  The previous tennents has been evicted and never returned to collect their things (which seems really stupid to me because as I understand it you buy the junk to make meth in bulk and I'm sure all that crap gets expensive) and when the previous, previous, previous landlords came to haul their stuff out to the end of the street, they found a crap-load of stuff with all the makings of a meth lab.  Then the police were brought in and it was declared unfit for human habitants without serious rennovation and cleaning blah blah blah.  And from that point on it was used primarily as a place for storage as opposed to a home.  The previous two landlords gutted it of all appliances and tore into several of the walls but beyond that it wasn't touched.  

My current landlord went in with an untold amount of money and is now renting it out for something like 700 a month.  And it's now 'meth free' or whatever.  I'm not sure whether he really did all of the work required or if he paid someone off but I'll say this, it's a dang nice apartment.


You know, I had this whole segue about living with filth and pestilence and I completely forgot it while watching this whole Mayan gang-rape scene.

Dang.

Oh well, back to the movie.  

*hearts*

L~bug

I am so leaving the country in October.  I'm not totally sure where yet.  But there will be a boat.  There will be beaches.  There will be a supa-cheap wardrobe.  And there will be fun and no thoughts of the ex.  

Unless I change my happy little mind in the next twenty seconds or so.

How do I get myself in these messes?  

OIY VEY!  


I hate boys.


L~bug

This story starts several years ago at a football game.  Fate and the odd friend or two stepped in and introduced a young woman to a young man.  It was love at first sight for him and a crush for her.  That night, he begged her parents to let him drive her home, they could follow him or he would follow them.  For some reason, they agreed, and that was their first date.

But there was a problem:  he was 17, getting ready to be 18 and she was getting ready to turn 15.  But he was determined to be with her.  So he sat down with her parents and told them he was willing to do whatever they wanted if they would allow him to date her.  Again, for some reason, her parents agreed.  And thus for the next year he could be found at her house, sitting with her in either the living room, dining room or den, always supervised after school and occassionally out on the town with her and her parents or sister.  

But what would a love story be without a touch of tragedy?

One day, another boy entered the picture.  He was closer in age to the her, he was hip and modern and she felt it was time to try something new.

And so they broke up.  She spent the next three months with Mr. Hip and Modern, he spent 90 days out of sorts and completely miserable.  They passed each other in the hallways at school, they parked near one another.  Old feelings were hard to let go and one day Mr. Hip and Modern wasn't so hip any more.

They reunited, they fell in love.  He graduated and went into the workforce.  Her birthday rolled around and there was a tiny diamond--a promise ring, a symbol of things to come.  

Christmas following her 18th birthday came with snow and larger diamond.  Wedding invitations, pictures, music, dresses; her life became a staple of samples and dates.  She found a grown-up job in a dentist's office.  He found an apartment, they signed the lease and waited on the last 90 days of their single lives.

Bows, stamps and rehersals were the words of the hour.  One month passed, then the second, now they were only 30 days away.  The groom's mother began to fret over losing her son.  She refused to attend the bridal shower and threatened to boycott the wedding.  He talked with his mother, there was a fight.  

The wedding went on as planned.  100 guests, mother-of-the-groom included, a lovely spring day that hadn't seen rain in 7 years, things couldn't have been more perfect.  

And thus the story of Michelle and Dustin.

Congratulations you two!  It was a beautiful wedding and I love you both!

I had an interesting weekend.  Last week I went to lunch with some of my chicas from the DA's office.  We met up with a former co-worker at La Capina in Piney Flats (scary Mexican, not bad but have a bathroom on hand about two hours afterwards, trust me on that).  Anyway, ST and RC told me about going to this country music club and invited me to go along with them.  

So I met up with ST after work at C-L and did some shopping at Target before heading back over to her place to get ready.  We got all spiffed up and RC and her husband TC came over.  ST's husband was on his way back from a run and he and T were going to go out on their own.  

So ST, RC and I bebopped to Applebee's where we had the prettiest server.  His name was David, he's a triathelete and he's gorgeous (I totally recommend going to see him every day).  We had a great time over chips, queso, chicken tenders, the veggie patch pizza and perfect margaritas.  Then we got the bill.

Moving on.

Then we headed over to the aforementioned club.  Ok, maybe 'club' is a setting the bar a bit too high.  It's a dive.  Seriously.  You could probably even pick it out on an aerial plat.  It would be the bit of land behind the not-quite so small cancer-causing black cloud of smut and watered-down shots.   Not to mention the small army of our South of the Border buddies.  These were definately not Mexi-tot material. 

Anyway, we met up with B a gal that RC works with and headed on in.  As I stated before, there's a hefty amount of smoke hanging in the air, the bar stools are tiny and butt-numbing and the booze is watered down but if you like people-watching, this is definately the place for you.  

ST, RC and B spent the next five hours or so dancing and drinking--watching RC get wasted was hilarious, some of the things she said were priceless.  If only she and ST understood the value of the LJ quote.  Oh well, I totally plan on posting them anyway.

We left the dive sometime around 2 a.m. and headed back to ST's home.  I headed home while ST and RC went to find their men.  

So, here are the things I learned at the local dive:

It is THE PLACE to watch future child support cases at their very inception.
There are two types of Mexicans that typically frequent the dive:  Booty Bumpers and Boobie Bumpers.  (Guess how they get one of those titles?)
At some point in your life, you do need someone to say to you, "Hey, maybe you should rethink trying to shop at Wet Seal.  I mean, you are like 50."
Wow, Michael Jackson really is white.  And he was able to grow facial hair.


Quotes:
"Just because I'm drunk does NOT mean I'm going to f*** you."  To a Booty Bumper.
"Hey, is that a Goth?"  "In a country music club, no way!" "Dude!  It is a goth!"  "D**n! So it is."

4 hours 
+ 
32 oz of yummy Starbucks Pomegranate Juice Blend 
+ 
never-ending phone calls 
= 
majorly huge mess to clean up.

Once you have been tagged, you have to write an entry with 10 weird random things, facts, or habits about yourself. At the end, you choose 5 people to be tagged, list their names, and why you chose them.


1.  I am highly allergic to hemp and other hemp-like plants.  Seriously.
2.  I freakin' hate crickets.  Especially the larger varieties.
3.  In times of high stress, I develop a tic wherein I constantly pick at my eyelashes and eyebrows.  
4.  I have a bad habit of picking at my lips when they get dry.  Unfortunately, picking at them makes them dry, thus perpetuating a vicious cycle.
5.  I don't read books, I devour them.  I wish I had more time to do this.
6.  I used to play the piano.  During this time, there was one summer I played at over 80 weddings at which I had the unfortunate job of playing My Heart Will Go On.  By the end of summer I'd played that song a total of 197 times.
7.  I really hate My Heart Will Go On.
8.  I've only really made my mother insanely furious three times in my life:  when I shook up an unopened Pepsi in the kitchen and it spewed, when we got into a shouting match over something my father said, and when I broke nearly all the strings in my piano by playing Chopin's Revolutionary Etude over and over and over.  
9.  I can't dance to save my life.  In fact, if I attempt to dance, lives will usually be lost.
10.  I have great aspirations to be a neat and organized person, instead I tend to find myself up to my eyeballs in organized chaos.  

Tag You're It:
Jessa, Erica, Sissy, Tom and ... someone else, I don't know who.

So I finally got my laptop up and running and occassionally hooked up to the internet.  I'm hoping that I got everything all updated and running because I'll be supa-ticked if I end up with some sort of virus.  I *hearts* my laptop, it's all smooth and shiney and new and fast and oh! it has airplane-grade aluminum (whatever that means).

So I'm all stretched out on our massively long-arse couch with Spuddy, watching Steel Magnolias, one of my favorite movies.  I've been on a Blockbuster kick since they've got a ton of their movies 4 for $20.  So yeah, I've almost doubled my DVD collection in two weeks.  Bad L~bug but at least it keeps the boredom away.

Ms. Irmare and I have been on a spring cleaning kick the past few weeks.  We've acquired some new furniture--well, me more than she--and I've been trying to (finally) get my room the way I want it.  

Work is stressful.  I'm really behind but I'm hoping I can get my electronic work caught up by the end of next week.  I'm sure something else will happen and I'll end up even more behind than I already am but I'm keeping my digits and bits crossed.

My oldest friend's little sister is getting married in a week or so.  I can't believe that my little Michelle is getting married.  I remember when she was still in her car seat and ripping my hair out in chunks.  I hated her then.  But she grew up into one of the most incredibly beauiful women I know, both inside and out.  And believe me, when the girl wore "Billy Bob" teeth as an accessory to her Home Coming gown, I knew the girl was going places.  

McFishy died almost a month ago.  He was my swifty white little betta and I miss him.  :(

And I think that's been about it except for that guy that I need to update you all on--so not ready to date yet.  Bad idea all around for the L~bug.  Very bad idea.

But that will be for another night.  So until then....


*hearts*

L~bug

Just call me The Bastardizer.


I'm soooo going to end up with police protection over this one....

I have a love-hate relationship with one realtor.  She offers to buy me lunch and brings me delicious fruit from local vendors and gives me incredible advice on where to find great shopping deals.   On the other hand, she very ballsy and pushy and type-A and she really enjoys telling me how to do my job.  

Take today, I have not delievered the mail yet, nor have I gone to work in the mail room because I'm saving making the listing folders for Sunday.  I have had no reason to be in the mail room whatsoever.  However, some helpful soul decided to divy out the faxes that came in today (something I do in the morning and at 5:30) but whomever was apparently stopped mid-fax sorting and left the faxes in various piles in the mailroom.  Still not having gone into the mail room I know NOTHING about this.  S. on the other hand, feels MY mess needs to be cleaned up and proceeded to march her happy self up front and tell me that I really don't need to leave THEIR faxes just lying around and that I need to "keep on top of my duties" like the faxes and keeping the office clean.

My response:

"Begging your pardon, but I've not touched the faxes since I came in at 8:30 this morning.  I don't do the faxes until 5:30 unless I hear the fax ring more than four times in an hour.  And as for keeping the office clean, that would be a lot easier on me if some people didn't leave their coffee cups up on top of their cubical so that mold begins to form in the residue or plates full of crumbs on shelves in unused rooms.  And for that matter, I'm not paid enough to be your cleaning crew.  You're messes are your responsiblity, not mine."

It has not been a happy day.

L~bug

I hate being less two feet away from someone--close enough to lean up and lick their hand if I really wanted to disgust them and myself--and say my name CLEARLY and hear them respond with "Well Keisha..."

I'm sorry, did you not just hear the two syllables that came out of my mouth?  I guaran-dang-tee I didn't add a "sh" sound to my name, so WHY are some so compelled to throw it in there?


*hearts*

L~bug

So I finally get a day off.  Like a whole day.  That I don't have to go to work/training/etc.  I really don't quite know what to do with myself.  Especially now that I've just about cleaned everything in my apartment.

Sorry I haven't called you back Tom, up until today I've been running around like a chicken with my head cut off.  I promise I'll call you back in the next couple of days.

My aunt is planning this big Easter shindig that I'm supposed to attend on Sunday.  She's asked me to bring a chocolate trifle though I'm not quite sure how I'll throw that one together.

Next week is supposedly the last week of training.  I'm not sure if I've been given permission to go or not (this turn of events stemming from how I'm apparently inept at my job and the whole drama that ensued the last time I was in training.).

But anyway, I think I'm gong to finish scrubbing the sink.  Yay for a clean sink!

*hearts*

L~bug

I'm in this mood (my mother would call it a 'tear') to redo everything.  Just gut it all and start over.  And I do mean everything from this blog to my wardrobe to my home.  Every. Single. Little. Thing.  I don't think this course of action will be very helpful (especially for my bank account) but I keep replaying this whole conversation I had with one of my C-L coworkers a couple of weeks ago:   M. said I needed to let go and be more spontaneous and drop my whole playing it safe routine.  And whilst I fretted over whether or not I'm really a great big stick in the mud, I couldn't shake the feeling that he was really telling me I should be a ho.  And then there was this whole cut to a shot of me sitting in the health clinic with the official health clinic lady explaining how one doing what I do (or hypothetically do (did?)) is prone to acquiring STDs.  And that, my dear friends, sent my indecision scrambling tail tucked back to the land of safely planned out like a Grizwald Family Vacation itenerary.

Oh and I want to marry an Indian.  Specifically the Indian who just rolled up into my office driving an $85,000+ Range Rover and (I thought) asked me if I liked Paris.  I responded that I had never been to France but I had been thinking of taking a tour especially of the WWI front lines.  

"Haha!  No.  I asked if you liked parrots.  You have pictures of birds on your screen.  Hahahahaha."

Yeah.  Go me!

More later, much love.

*hearts*

L~bug

P.S. I seriously about typed "butt" instead of bug...

So I finally put upa pic on myspace.  Go me.

I'm still puddy sitting.  We're watching Dreamer, well I'm watching it and the puddies are all pouty-faced because I won't let them go outside to play in the snow.

Oh well, it's cold out and despite how cute they were rolling about in it all, they're nasty-cold and drippy.  And this does not make for a happy L~bug when they come booncing in demanding to sit on her lap (all at the same time).  So we are now shacked up and waiting out the happy little snow storm that's wrecking havoc on K-town's roads.

I saw a lot of red trucks today.  They make me sad.

I spent most of the work day at C-L sick with a headache.  I'm not sure if it was from lack of food, meds, or this nutty weather.  I'm still feeling it a bit, not as bad though.

And with this, it's time to get back to my movie.  I'll probably update tomorrow sometime, provided I'm not making folders for 5 hours.  I wouldn't hold my breath.

*hearts & hankies*

L~bug
